The user's favourite books are The Great Gatsby, which is a classic novel written in the early 20th century by F. Scott Fitzgerald. The novel is set in the summer of 1922, in the fictional town of West Egg on Long Island, New York. It follows the story of Nick Carraway, a young man who moves to the area to pursue a career in the bond business. He becomes involved in the lives of his wealthy neighbours, Tom and Daisy Buchanan, and Jay Gatsby, a mysterious and wealthy man who throws extravagant parties every weekend.

The novel is known for its vivid descriptions of the Jazz Age, a period of time in the United States that saw a rise in jazz music, flapper culture, and bootlegging. It also explores themes of love, wealth, and social class, as well as the impact of the past on the present. The writing style is considered to be elegant and sophisticated, with a focus on the use of language and the exploration of the human condition.

The novel has been widely praised for its expertly crafted prose, its exploration of the human condition, and its ability to transport readers back to the Jazz Age. It has been adapted into several films, plays, and television shows, and has been translated into multiple languages. It remains a staple of high school and college curriculums, and is widely regarded as one of the greatest American novels of all time.
